intro: Lappula tianschanica var. altaica, commonly known as the Tianshan lappula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its erect growth habit, with small, yellowish flowers clustered in racemes. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
